my_chess.scripts.Train¶

class my_chess.scripts.Train(setup_file: Optional[str] = None, debug: bool = False, restore: str = '', num_cpus: int = 1, num_gpus: float = 0.0, local_mode: bool = False, training_on: Optional[Union[my_chess.learner.environments.Environment, str]] = None, algorithm: Optional[Union[my_chess.learner.algorithms.trainable.Trainable, my_chess.learner.algorithms.algorithm.Algorithm, str]] = None, algorithm_config: Optional[Union[my_chess.learner.algorithms.trainable.TrainableConfig, my_chess.learner.algorithms.algorithm.AlgorithmConfig, str]] = None, policy: Optional[Union[my_chess.learner.policies.policy.Policy, str]] = None, policy_config: Optional[Union[my_chess.learner.policies.policy.PolicyConfig, str]] = None, model: Optional[Union[my_chess.learner.models.model.ModelRLLIB, str]] = None, model_config: Optional[Union[my_chess.learner.models.model.ModelRRLIBConfig, str]] = None, run_config: Optional[Union[ray.train.RunConfig, str]] = None, callback: Optional[ray.rllib.algorithms.callbacks.DefaultCallbacks] = None, framework: Literal['tf', 'torch'] = 'torch', **kwargs)¶

Bases: my_chess.scripts.Script

__init__(setup_file: Optional[str] = None, debug: bool = False, restore: str = '', num_cpus: int = 1, num_gpus: float = 0.0, local_mode: bool = False, training_on: Optional[Union[my_chess.learner.environments.Environment, str]] = None, algorithm: Optional[Union[my_chess.learner.algorithms.trainable.Trainable, my_chess.learner.algorithms.algorithm.Algorithm, str]] = None, algorithm_config: Optional[Union[my_chess.learner.algorithms.trainable.TrainableConfig, my_chess.learner.algorithms.algorithm.AlgorithmConfig, str]] = None, policy: Optional[Union[my_chess.learner.policies.policy.Policy, str]] = None, policy_config: Optional[Union[my_chess.learner.policies.policy.PolicyConfig, str]] = None, model: Optional[Union[my_chess.learner.models.model.ModelRLLIB, str]] = None, model_config: Optional[Union[my_chess.learner.models.model.ModelRRLIBConfig, str]] = None, run_config: Optional[Union[ray.train.RunConfig, str]] = None, callback: Optional[ray.rllib.algorithms.callbacks.DefaultCallbacks] = None, framework: Literal['tf', 'torch'] = 'torch', **kwargs) → None¶

Create a training script for a machine learning model.

Parameters

  • setup_file – Path to training parameters.

  • debug – Boolean determining wether to enable debug mode.

  • restore – Tuner checkpoint path from which to continue.

  • num_cpus – Number of cpus to allocate to session.

  • num_gpus – Number of gpus to allocate to session (including fractional amounts).

  • local_mode – Boolean limiting session to be run locally.

  • training_on – Name of training set, either an environment or dataset.

  • algorithm – Name of training algorithm.

  • algorithm_config – Name of training algorithm configuration (named defaults will be used).

  • policy – Name of action policy.

  • policy_config – Name of action policy configuration (named defaults will be used).

  • model – Name of model being trained.

  • model_config – Name of training algorithm configuration (named defaults will be used).

  • run_config – Name of run configuration to be used.

  • callback – Name of in training callback to be used.

  • framework – Name of framework to be used (e.g. torch or tf)

Methods

__init__([setup_file, debug, restore, ...])

Create a training script for a machine learning model.

complete_run()

Runs argument parser before running script.

getAlgConfig()

getArgumentCollector()

parseArgs()

run()

Activate model training.

update(**kwargs)

complete_run()¶

Runs argument parser before running script.

Useful for allowing files to run scripts dynamically from the terminal.

run()¶

Activate model training.

Based on the preset options of the constructor, a ray server is initiated and a new or existing tuning experiment is run. Once complete, the ray server is shutdown.

Args:
